definition: (to act) on one's own initiative
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: In other words, learning spontaneously is one of man's unique traits.
sentences.chinese: 換言之，自動自發的學習是人類的獨特性質之一。

sentences.english: Perceiving people tend to be more spontaneous, sometimes careless.
sentences.chinese: 理解性的人比較自動自發，有時不小心。

sentences.english: Beware of a theology produced by spontaneous generation.
sentences.chinese: 留心這自動自發的世代生出的神學。

sentences.english: Automatic spontaneous child to go over the ends of the earth to be popular everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 自動自發的孩子就是走遍海角天涯都處處受歡迎。

definition: vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
to put forward plans and ideas (also derogatory)/to give advice (idiom)
to reveal the cloven foot (idiom); to unmask one's true nature/to give the game away
impoverished/backward both economically and culturally
selfless/impartial
supplementary cash reserve/private fund/private hoard/slush fund

to look favorably on sth/would be glad to see it happen

to show every possible consideration (idiom); meticulous care
industrious and conscientious/assiduous
